intro: Chaetanthera grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered chaetanthera, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture and a slightly aromatic scent.
